text:
FRESH BANDITS ATTACK ON WASSAGU COMMUNITY: EIGHT FARMERS ABDUCTED 

A fresh bandit attack has been reported in  farming communities in the Wasagu area of Kebbi State, resulting in the abduction of eight farmers and the shooting of another.

This was confirmed by Chairman of Danko Wassagu Local Government, Hussaini Wasagu,.

The local government chairman said the attackers struck  in the afternoon while farmers were on their fields.

According to him  Eight  farmers were taken away, and one person was shot,‚Äù he said.

He said the  injured victim is receiving treatment at the Wasagu General Hospital, while the council are working with security agencies to ensure the safe return of those abducted.‚Äù

Community members say the gunmen, suspected to have crossed in from neighbouring Zamfara State, operated for several minutes before escaping with their victims.

text:
79th Birthday Felicitation and 17th Annual Founder‚Äôs Day Tribute to the Founder of AUN 
- Barr. Abubakar Malami (SAN)

From the Founder of Rayhan University, Birnin Kebbi

AUN: An Embodiment of Its Founder‚Äôs Generosity, Ideals, and Belief in Nigeria‚Äôs Future

As the American University of Nigeria (AUN) marks its 17th Annual Founder‚Äôs Day, I, Abubakar Malami, SAN, Founder of Rayhan University, Birnin Kebbi, extend my heartfelt felicitations to His Excellency Atiku Abubakar, GCON, the visionary whose enduring commitment to education continues to inspire generations.

This Founder‚Äôs Day is a powerful reminder of the dream you set in motion‚Äîan institution built on excellence, community service, and the transformative potential of knowledge. AUN stands today as a shining embodiment of your generosity, your ideals, and your unwavering belief in the future of Nigeria. Through this university, you have demonstrated that true leadership is measured in the institutions one builds and the lives one empowers.

As we celebrate this remarkable milestone in AUN‚Äôs journey, I also take this opportunity to extend warm advance felicitations as you prepare to mark your 79th birthday on November 25th. Your life has been defined by service, vision, and an unrelenting commitment to national development. AUN remains one of the most enduring testaments to that legacy.

As a fellow university founder, I draw deep inspiration from your accomplishments. Rayhan University stands encouraged by the path you have charted‚Äîone that elevates education as the cornerstone of national progress and equips young Nigerians to take their rightful place on the global stage.

On this significant Founder‚Äôs Day, and ahead of your 79th birthday, I join your family, the AUN community, and millions across the nation in celebrating your contributions to education and nation-building. May the Almighty continue to strengthen, guide, and bless you.

Congratulations, Your Excellency, and congratulations to the entire AUN family on this momentous occasion.

text:
Let‚Äôs be very honest with ourselves as Nigerians. President Bola Ahmed Tinubu did not send @Bellomatawalle1  to Kebbi by accident.
This is a strategic, experience-based deployment, and one thing we know about this administration is that appointments are increasingly tied to competence and capacity, not sentiment.
He has been here before.
This is the same man who, as Governor of Zamfara, restored long stretches of stability, brokered delicate security engagements, and oversaw the rescue of thousands of abducted citizens, including the famous Kankara schoolboys.
You don't gain that kind of experience from watching ‚ÄúCrime & Justice Series‚Äù you earn it on the field.

The North West is a complex terrain with its own unique players, networks, and dynamics.
But Matawalle understands it, not from a distance, but from years of practical, hands-on involvement.
That is why President Tinubu deployed him where his expertise matters most.

Right now, as the nation anticipates the safe return of the abducted Kebbi schoolgirls, what Nigeria needs is competent, battle-tested leadership, not guesswork.
Matawalle‚Äôs presence in Kebbi is a strong signal that the Federal Government is taking this matter with utmost seriousness.
So, Nigerians, let‚Äôs stay calm, stay hopeful, and trust the process.
From President Tinubu, to the security architecture, to the ministers on ground, this is a government that understands the assignment and carries it out with purpose.

After all, when it comes to national security, we don‚Äôt need theatrics; we need results, and the right people are already on the job.
